description: Non Material Amendment to Planning Permission 19/02482/FUL (Change of use of motorcycle show sales units 318, 320 and 312(Class Sui Generis) to Retail (Class A1). Demolition of the existing ground and first floor rear extensions, ancillary buildings and the 1.5 storey workshop to the side and rear of unit 318 and 320 Ewell Road. Erection of a single, two and three storey extension to the eastern side and rear of the existing building unit 318 and 320 and further internal alterations. Erection of two semi-detached properties to the rear of the site to accommodate 2x retail and 9 residential units with provision of 6 parking spaces and 16 cycle stores.) to provide provisional layout changes to  semi detached dwellings to rear of the property.
decision_conditions: Condition 1 of planning permission 19/02482/FUL is amended as follows:The approved development shall be carried out in accordance with the following drawings/details:2490-W101 - Proposed Ground Floor Plan (Semi-Detached Dwellinghouses)2490-W102 - Proposed First Floor Plan (Semi-Detached Dwellinghouses)2490-W103 - Proposed Roof Plan (Semi-Detached Dwellinghouses)2490-W201 - Proposed Front and Rear Elevations (Semi-Detached Dwellinghouses)18024(PA)100 - Proposed Ground Floor Plan (Development excluding Semi-Detached Dwellinghouses)18024(PA)101 - Proposed First Floor Plan (Development excluding Semi-Detached Dwellinghouses)18024(PA)103 - Proposed Roof Plan (Excluding Semi-Detached Dwellinghouses)18024(PA)200 - Proposed Front and Rear Elevations (Excluding Semi-Detached Dwellinghouses)18024(PA)201 - Proposed Front and Rear Elevations (Excluding Semi-Detached Dwellinghouses)18024(PA)202 - Proposed Section EE18024(PA)300 - Existing - Proposed Section AAReason: For the avoidance of doubt and in the interests of proper planning.
The Council consider the amendments to be non-material and as such, it is recommended that a S96A application for a non-material amendment is approved.

Condition 17 of planning permission 19/02482/FUL is carried across and reapplied to this permission as follows:Prior to beneficial occupation of the development to which this permission relates, any windows or rooflights at first floor level or above in the eastern (rear) elevation of the semi-detached dwellings (including the enlarged window serving the family bathrooms hereby approved under this application) shall be constructed so that no part of the framework less than 1.7m above finished floor level shall be openable.Any part below that level shall be fitted with, and retained in, obscure glazing to a minimum of level 3 on the standard scale. Any film used to achieve the requisite obscurity level shall be non-perishable and tamperproof, and shall be replaced immediately in the event that it ceases to result in obscurity to level 3.Reason: To ensure satisfactory living conditions for neighbouring occupiers, in accordance with policy DM10 of the LDF Core Strategy 2012.
